message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a computer vision approach for indoor localization of micro aerial vehicles, which falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO). The approach uses textons, which are characteristic image patches, and a $k$-Nearest Neighbors algorithm, which are both techniques commonly used in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also mentions the use of a particle filter, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) for state estimation. The evaluation technique developed to compare environments and identify critical areas within them could also fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the scalability of the approach to different platforms, which could fall under the category of control systems (cs.SY).
